translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
Fourth Section
The Discussion of Endowed
“Is an Arahant endowed with the four fruits?”
“Yes.”

original: Arahā catūhi phassehi catūhi vedanāhi catūhi saññāhi catūhi cetanāhi catūhi cittehi catūhi saddhāhi catūhi vīriyehi catūhi satīhi catūhi samādhīhi catūhi paññāhi samannāgatoti?

“Is a non-returner endowed with three fruits?”
“Yes.”

original: Anāgāmī tīhi phassehi …pe… tīhi paññāhi samannāgatoti?
analyzed: anāgāmī tīhi phassehi pe tīhi paññāhi samannāgato ti
translated: “Is a non-returner endowed with three kinds of contact … three kinds of wisdom?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the abandoning of lust, the abandoning of hatred, the abandoning of delusion?
“Is a once-returner endowed with two fruits?”
“Yes.”

Is a non-returner endowed with the fruit of once-returning?
He answers: “Yes.”
But isn’t it true that a non-returner has gone beyond the fruit of once-returning?

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci anāgāmī sakadāgāmiphalaṁ vītivatto, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci anāgāmī sakadāgāmi phalam vītivattaḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: He answers: “Yes.”🔽Then you have lost this argument.
It is not right to say that a non-returner has gone beyond the fruit of once-returning but is still endowed with it.

analyzed: anāgāmī sakadāgāmi phalam vītivatto tena samannāgataḥ ti
translated: Is a non-returner who has gone beyond the fruit of once-returning endowed with it?
He answers: “Yes.”

He answers: “No.”

He answers: “Yes.”

original: Sakadāgāmī sotāpattimaggaṁ vītivatto, sakkāyadiṭṭhiṁ …pe… apāyagamanīyaṁ mohaṁ vītivatto tena samannāgatoti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….

original: Nanu arahatā cattāri phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca aparihīnoti?
analyzed: nanu arahatā cattāri phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca a parihīnaḥ ti
translated: “Is it not the case that a perfected one has attained the four fruits and does not fall away from them?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci arahatā cattāri phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca aparihīno, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci arahatā cattāri phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca a parihīnaḥ tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”
“Then you should say that a perfected one is endowed with the four fruits.”

analyzed: na vattabba  anāgāmī tīhi phalehi samannāgataḥ ti  āmantā
translated: “You should not say that.”

original: Nanu anāgāminā tīṇi phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca aparihīnoti?
analyzed: nanu anāgāminā tīṇi phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca
translated: “Is it not the case that a non-returner has attained the three fruits and does not fall away from them?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci anāgāminā tīṇi phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca aparihīno, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci anāgāminā tīṇi phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca a parihīnaḥ tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”
“Then you should say that a non-returner is endowed with the three fruits.”
“You should not say that.”
“Is it not the case that a once-returner has attained the two fruits and does not fall away from them?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu sakadāgāminā dve phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca aparihīnoti?
analyzed: nanu sakadāgāminā dve phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca
translated: “But haven’t the once-returner attained two fruits and doesn’t he/she not fall away from them?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci sakadāgāminā dve phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca aparihīno, tena vata re vattabbe—🔽“sakadāgāmī dvīhi phalehi samannāgato”ti.

translated: “Well then, you should say that the once-returner is endowed with two fruits.

original: Arahatā cattāri phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca aparihīnoti, arahā catūhi phalehi samannāgatoti?
analyzed: arahatā cattāri phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca a parihīnaḥ ti arahā catūhi phalehi samannāgatoti
translated: “The perfected one has attained four fruits and doesn’t fall away from them. So the perfected one is endowed with four fruits?”
“Yes.”

original: Arahatā cattāro maggā paṭiladdhā tehi ca aparihīnoti, arahā catūhi maggehi samannāgatoti?
analyzed: arahatā cattāro maggā paṭiladdhā tehi ca a parihīnaḥ ti arahā catūhi maggehi samannāgatoti
translated: “The perfected one has attained four paths and doesn’t fall away from them. So the perfected one is endowed with four paths?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …

original: Anāgāminā tīṇi phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca aparihīnoti, anāgāmī tīhi phalehi samannāgatoti?
analyzed: anāgāminā tīṇi phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca a parihīnaḥ ti anāgāmī tīhi phalehi samannāgataḥ ti
translated: “The non-returner has attained three fruits and doesn’t fall away from them. So the non-returner is endowed with three fruits?”
“Yes.”

original: Anāgāminā tayo maggā paṭiladdhā tehi ca aparihīnoti, anāgāmī tīhi maggehi samannāgatoti?
analyzed: anāgāminā tayo maggā paṭiladdhā tehi ca a parihīnaḥ ti anāgāmī tīhi maggehi samannāgatoti
translated: “The non-returner has attained three paths and doesn’t fall away from them. So the non-returner is endowed with three paths?”

“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty … in the ear faculty … in the nose faculty … in the tongue faculty … in the body faculty … in the mind faculty?” …

original: Sakadāgāminā dve phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca aparihīnoti, sakadāgāmī dvīhi phalehi samannāgatoti?
analyzed: sakadāgāminā dve phalāni paṭiladdhāni tehi ca a parihīnaḥ ti sakadāgāmī dvīhi phalehi samannāgataḥ ti
translated: “The once-returner has attained two fruits and has not fallen away from them. Is the once-returner endowed with two fruits?”
“Yes.”

original: Sakadāgāminā dve maggā paṭiladdhā tehi ca aparihīnoti, sakadāgāmī dvīhi maggehi samannāgatoti?
analyzed: sakadāgāminā dve maggā paṭiladdhā tehi ca a parihīnaḥ ti sakadāgāmī dvīhi maggehi samannāgato ti
translated: “The once-returner has attained two paths and has not fallen away from them. Is the once-returner endowed with two paths?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …
The Discussion of Endowed is finished.
